snippet: A look at what has happened in Massachusetts and more recently at Walmart is instructive.
abstract: The Upshot; Walmart announces that many more of its workers have signed up for its health insurance; increase, if permanent, will cost the company more money but it illustrates how Affordable Care Act is set up to build on country's existing insurance system rather than tear it down; in Massachusetts, where health reform was broadly popular, residents with employer-based insurance went to 65.6 percent in 2008, up from 61 percent in 2006.
lead_paragraph: A look at what has happened in Massachusetts and more recently at Walmart is instructive.

headline.print_headline: Why More People Might Get Health Insurance From Work
headline.main: Why More, Not Fewer, People Might Start Getting Health Insurance Through Work

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
